overview: The most straightforward way to customize a codebook is to define a settings object whose properties describe the codebook's behavior and appearance. The settings object can be passed as the second argument to `webcodebook.createCodebook()` (or its alias `webcodebook.createChart()`). All defaults can be overwritten by users when creating a codebook. Parameters for the settings object are described in detail below.

filters.title: Filters
filters.description: an array of filter variables; by default variables with 10 or fewer levels become filters

value_col.title: Variable Name
value_col.description: the name of the filter variable

label.title: Variable Label
label.description: a label that describes the filter variable

groups.title: Groups
groups.description: an array of group variables; by default variables with 5 or fewer levels become group options

value_col.title: Variable Name
value_col.description: the name of the group variable

label.title: Variable Label
label.description: a label that describes the group variable

variableLabels.title: Variable Labels
variableLabels.description: an array of variable objects with both the variable name and a brief description of the variable

label.title: Variable Label
label.description: a label that describes the variable

hiddenVariables.title: Hidden Variables
hiddenVariables.description: an array of variables that will be hidden throughout the codebook

label.title: Variable Label
label.description: a label that describes the variable

group.title: Group?
group.description: includes variable as a group option

type.title: Variable Type
type.description: the type of data contained in the variable

autogroups.title: Level Cutoff to Choose Group Variables
autogroups.description: the number of levels in a variable over which the variable will not be added as a group option

autofilter.title: Level Cutoff to Choose Filter Variables
autofilter.description: the number of levels in a variable over which the variable will not be added as a filter

autobins.title: Automatically Choose Number of Bins in Histogram?
autobins.description: the number of bins in histograms will be determined algorithmically based on the range of the variable and the number of observations

nBins.title: Number of Bins in Histogram
nBins.description: the number of bins in which to split out each continuous variable into

levelSplit.title: Level Cutoff to Choose Horizontal or Vertical Bar Charts
levelSplit.description: the number of levels in a variable over which the variable will be summarized with a vertical bar chart as opposed to a horizontal bar chart

controlVisibility.title: Control Visibility
controlVisibility.description: the initial state of the display of the controls

chartVisibility.title: Chart Visibility
chartVisibility.description: the initial state of the display of the charts

tabs.title: Codebook Tabs
tabs.description: an array of the tabs displayed in the codebook

dataName.title: Data Name
dataName.description: the name of the data file summarized in the codebook
